channel.title: Question? Delta Lol
channel.description:
Ok so im trying to add herblore to my server. and right now i have a snippet of a herblore code.. but its in client.java which is kind of sketchy. I wanna make a new .txt file with *herblore* . so i did. i compiled ran server and the herblore still didnt work. So i guess my question is. How can u make the server reconize the new txt pad
The code works in client.java but not in Herblore.txt How can i make it work? Please someone explain because i have a couple of these i will be making and the herblore is just a start.
I need to know how to create a new file that can handle herblore named *herblore* instead of all my codes in client taking up all my processes can sumone help?

item.title: Question? Delta Lol
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

It should, just google a tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: Question? Delta Lol
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

How do i know what to code in the class file from the herblore.java because if i find a code for herblore class on google will it be the same for this snippet i have. UUUH my head lol But least im learning sum newww stuff Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Question? Delta Lol
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

No :P. A .class file is just byte code, it’s read by the java interpreter to run the codes functionality. class is commonly referred to instead of saying .java or java file.

You need to properly write a functional class structure for the herblore class to even work.

public class Herblore { //code goes here }

You can google a tutorial on how to make herblore a separate class from the client class.

Read full topic

item.title: Question? Delta Lol
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

Ok so im trying to understand this ( kinda stoned ) And so far i know. so i must make a file .class? or can you give me some more hints for creating a class for this if its a code.

I dont want to add this to client.java as it unessicary process + i need to learn how to do this for a lot of other skills too.

i made a herblore.class file with the snippet saved inside… and added it to the class prt compiled and still got 100 errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Question? Delta Lol
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

You don’t have a class structure so of course it would throw 100 errors.
http://www.java-samples.com/showtutorial.php?tutorialid=13

And if it’s a snippet just add it into your client class. Although, you can google a tutorial for seperate classed skills.

Read full topic
